definition: to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate

sentences.english: Eg:Mary jop-hopped to a famous computer company.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗跳槽去了一個著名的計算機公司。

sentences.english: On his return to England, Winder made the move to a senior position at Penguin seven years ago.
sentences.chinese: 七年前，溫德回到英格蘭後就跳槽到企鵝集團高就了。

sentences.english: Is Li Xiang's job-hopping true or speculation?
sentences.chinese: 李湘跳槽副臺長蓄意炒作還是真有其事？

sentences.english: In 1994 I took all these acquired skills, headed in a new direction, and changed careers.
sentences.chinese: 在掌握了所有這些技能後，我於1994年跳槽改行。

sentences.english: Recently, my insurance broker switched companies.
sentences.chinese: 最近，我的保險經紀人跳槽了。

sentences.english: Job-hopping, however, is still a topic on which no consensus has been reached.
sentences.chinese: 然而，跳槽仍然是一個有爭議的課題。

sentences.english: Therefore, the unit with higher pay is one of the reasons for job-hopping.
sentences.chinese: 所以性價比高的單位仍然是誘惑跳槽又原因之一。

sentences.english: I'm able to move around, but it is very difficult.
He job-hopped to establish Zhonghua Book Company on the New Years Day of 1912.
sentences.chinese: 1912年元旦，他從商務“跳槽”而創辦中華書局。

sentences.english: We are in this lonely sandbank, making it much easier to teach the teachers a job.
sentences.chinese: 在我們這塊寂寞沙洲上，任教的老師就更容易跳槽了。

sentences.english: Search firms say they are finding it harder to lure prospective candidates.
sentences.chinese: 獵頭公司稱，他們發現現在更難吸引潛在的跳槽者了。

sentences.english: Job hoppers were the norm during those years.
sentences.chinese: 跳槽在那幾年成爲一種標準。

sentences.english: But this doesn't mean the days of frequent job-hopping are over.
sentences.chinese: 但是這並不意味着頻頻跳槽的日子已經過去。

sentences.english: Job hopping is the initiative act on the policy.
sentences.chinese: “跳槽”是借勢自我落實政策的主動行爲。

sentences.english: Some companies are encouraging lateral moves explicitly.
sentences.chinese: 一些公司也開始明確鼓勵員工平級跳槽。

definition: to retire/to leave office/to quit a job
to get a better job somewhere else (idiom)/to seek alternative employment
to cut staff/to lay off employees
to quit one's job (without having another one)
to poach (talent, personnel from competitors)/to raid (a competitor for its talent)/Taiwan pr. [wa1 jiao3]
executive/senior management/(contraction of 高級管理|高级管理)
